title: Ticket #5365: HTCondor View: Move query logic back to HTML
description:
Move the logic for setting up the query (and thus the links that toggle them) back into the HTML. This will require getting a better API allowing specifying:

  • Query for graph. May be null to specify no graph.
  • Query for table. May be null to specify no table.
  • Query for graph when a table element is clicked on, with placeholders (Say '{1}' '{2}')
  • Which fields in the able should be dropped into the placeholders on row click. May be null to specify to ignore clicks.

Modify the default index.html to use this interface, with the selection of data source being handled there. (Date range, maybe? Maybe just keep in the Javascript)

This does not include work to allow multiple graphs on a single page, which will require eliminating the remaining global assumptions. That work is Ticket #5366: HTCondor View: multiple charts in one page

Proposed API: 

// The tag with this id will have the graph/table put inside.
var id = 'my_div_id';

// Afterquery arguments for this graph. If null/undefined/empty
// string, there is no graph at all.
var graph_args = "url=foo.json&title=My Chart&filter...chart=stacked";

// Afterquest arguments for this table. If null/undefined/empty
// string, there is no graph at all.
var table_args = "url=foo.json&title=My Chart&filter...";

// If null/undefined/empty string, selecting a row in the table
// does nothing. If there is no table, this argument is ignored.
// If there is no graph, this argument is ignored.
// Otherwise, this is a list of fields in the table that can be
// used to filter the graph.  When a row in the table is
// selected, the graph arguments will have a
// 'filter=FIELDNAME=SELECTEDVALUE' entry added to the front for
// each element in the tuple.
var selection_tuple = ['Arch', 'OpSys'];

new HTCondorView(div_id, graph_args, table_args, selection_tuple);
